title.narrative: 3. HIV PREVENTION AND CARE

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Health's technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child health services, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Hiv Prevention, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Women of childbearing age, pregnant women, newborns, boys and girls under age 5 years and adolescents use quality health services at health facilities and in communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Health?s technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child healthservices, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community.

description.narrative: Boosting access to early HIV diagnosis in children, Unicef donated two Point of Care (PoC) machines to strengthen PMTCT. The country has acquired 10 additional point-of-care devices bringing the total number of devices to 13 as a result of this support and; high level advocacy , which strengthened the decentralization of pediatric HIV diagnostic capacity. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
